code: @Manual{,   title = {stcsanalysis: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables},   author = {Jaromil Frossard},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://swiss-transplant-cohort-study.github.io/stcsanalysis/}, }

what: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: stcsanalysis package contains function handle STCS analysis tables.

title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: can install development version stcsanalysis like :

title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: can create table using:
code: library(stcsanalysis) stcs <- stcs_read("dir/to/analysis/tables")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>    add_var(stcs,c("age"))|>    expand_var_from(stcs,from="transplantation",by="patientkey",.var="soaskey")|>    expand_var_from(stcs,from="organ",by="soaskey",.var="organkey")|>    add_var(stcs,c("organ","tpxdate"))|>    add_var(stcs,"deathdate",from = "stop", by = "patientkey",.filter = !is.na(deathdate))

what: Generic function to add columns — add_var
title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: Generic function add columns

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
code: add_var(   data,   stcs,   .var,   from = detect_from(stcs, .var),   by = detect_by(stcs, .var, from),   .filter )  expand_var_from(data, stcs, .var, from, by, .filter)  new_var_from(data, stcs, .var, from, by, .filter, relationship)

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: data data frame STCS key (). stcs list containing STCS data frame. .var chr. name variables add. can named vector (rename) length >1. chr. name dataset stcs object chr. named vector used matching. Argument passed left_join. names() matches variable data matches variable stcs$. .filter optional argument can use filter stcs$matching. relationship chr. Argument passed left_join.

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: data frame new column.

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
code: if (FALSE) { stcs <- stcs_read("path/to/stcs/dataset/")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>    add_var(stcs,"sex")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>   expand_var_from(stcs,"patlongkey",from="patientlongitudinal","patientkey") |>   add_var(stcs,"bmi") }

text: data data.frame. data frame containing variables describe .patientkey .date stcs list. stcs object. .diseasekey chr. column name containing diseasekey add_infsite lgl. infection site included recoding. Default "". Either c("","","","+na").

title: Extract infection pathogen species data for recoding — categorize_pathogenspecies
text: data frame containing "patdiagnosis", "pathogen_species", "comment", "n_occurence".

title: Extract infection pathogen species data for recoding — categorize_pathogenspecies
text: add_infsite = "", infection site kept NA's. add_infsite = "yes", infection site added pathogens. add_infsite = "", infection site added "pathogen_species" "" (eg: one c("bacteria","fungi","parasites","viruses")). add_infsite = "+na", infection site added "pathogen_species" "" "comment" NA.

text: eGFR

eGFR — egfr_2021
text: crea_mumoll Numeric. Creatinin \(\mu\)mol/l age Numeric. Age years sex Character. Sex either "Male" "Female"

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
text: eGFR mL/min/1.73m\(^2\) described https://www.kidney.org/content/ckd-epi-creatinine-equation-2021. conversion factor creatinin 1 (\(\mu\)mol/l) = 88.42 (mg/dL)

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
text: Inker, L. ., Eneanya, N. D., Coresh, J., Tighiouart, H., Wang, D., Sang, Y., ... & Levey, . S. (2021). New creatinine-cystatin C–based equations estimate GFR without race. New England Journal Medicine, 385(19), 1737-1749.

what: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: crea_mumoll Numeric. Creatinin \(\mu\)mol/l height Numeric. Height meters.

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: eGFR mL/min/1.73m\(^2\) described https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19158356/. corresponds bedside formula: 0.413*height_cm/crea_mgdl. conversion factor creatinin 1 (\(\mu\)mol/l) = 88.42 (mg/dL).

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: Schwartz, G. J., Schneider, M. F., Maier, P. S., Moxey-Mims, M., Dharnidharka, V. R., Warady, B. ., ... & Muñoz, . (2012). Improved equations estimating GFR children chronic kidney disease using immunonephelometric determination cystatin C. Kidney international, 82(4), 445-453.

title: Select variable of the STCS dataset — select
text: stcs_anonymize(): remove sensitive variables. stcs_remove_emptytab(): remove empty tables, () stcs_select_organrelevance(): select variable based organ_relevance. stcs_select_table(): select tables.

title: Tailored analysis tables — tailored_table
text: stcs list containing STCS data frame. silent lgl. Specify warning returned.

title: Tailored analysis tables — tailored_table
text: data frame.

title: Tailored analysis tables — tailored_table
text: tailored_organsurvival(): PK: organkey. Main dates compute follow-time organs. 1. patientkey: Identifier patients. Source: Organ. 2. donorkey: Identifier donors. Source: Organ. 3. soaskey: Identifier transplantations. Source: Organ. 4. organkey: Identifier organs. Source: Organ. 5. tpxdate: Date transplantation. Source: Organ. 6. glo_date: Graft loss date. Source: Graftloss. 7. pnf_date: Date PNF (tpxdate dgf "PNF"). Source: Organ. 8.-16. last_[...]_toggle_date: Assessment date last mentioned filled toggle (keep: "Yes", "", removed: "Missing", NA). Source: OrganLongitudinal. 17. last_complete_organlongitudinal_crf_date: Assessment date latest crf_status organ assessment defined "Complete". Source: OrganLongitudinal. tailored_patientsurvival(): PK: patientkey. Main dates compute follow-time patients. 1. patientkey: Identifier patients. Source: Patient. 2. enrollment_date: Enrollment date. Source: Patient. 3. deathdate: Death date. Source: Stop. 4. first_dropoutdate: First dropout date. Source: Stop. 5. first_dropoutdateaccuracy: Accuracy first dropout date. Source: Stop. 6. last_activedropoutdate: Last dropout date without backstcs. Source: Stop. 7. last_activedropoutdateaccuracy: Accuracy last dropout date without backstcs. Source: Stop. 8. last_patlongkeys: Identifier last patient-assessment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 9. last_assdate: Date last patient-assessment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 10.-17. last_[...]_toggle_date: Assessment date last mentioned filled toggle (keep: "Yes", "", removed: "Missing", NA). Source: PatientLongitudinal. 18. extraction_date: Extraction date. Source: Admin. 19. last_complete_patientlongitudinal_crf_date: Assessment date latest crf_status patient assessment defined "Complete". Source: PatientLongitudinal. 20. last_complete_stop_crf_date: Date (latest : deathdate, dropoutdate, lastalivedate, backstcsdate) latest crf_status defined "Complete". Source: Stop. 21. last_consent_withdrawal_date: Last consent date consent status "Withdrawal". Source Patient. 22. confidental data: Optional. 23. last_complete_psq_crf_date: Optional. Date latest crf_status PSQ defined "Complete". Source: PSQ. tailored_psq(): PK: patlongkey. PSQ forms wide format.
